alert.note: Alert for Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 16 at 3:41AM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and wind expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches, with locally higher amounts above pass level. Winds gusting as high as 45 MPH. * WHERE...The Blackfoot Mountains, Caribou Range, Teton Valley, Centennial Mountains, and Island Park region, including but not limited to Grace, Soda Springs, Henry, Wayan, Swan Valley, Ashton, Tetonia, Driggs, Island Park, Raynolds Pass, and Targhee Pass. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to 2 PM Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained at 511.idaho.gov.

area.areaDesc: Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley
